step1.sentence: My brother only calls me once in a blue moon, so I was surprised to hear from him twice this week.

step2.story: The old bakery on Fifth Street was always packed, but Sarah only stopped by once in a blue moon. When she finally did, she always ordered the same almond croissant she had loved since childhood.

step3.story: Alex was not the kind of person who cooked elaborate meals. Most nights it was pasta or a sandwich eaten over the sink. But once in a blue moon, he would spend an entire Sunday in the kitchen — chopping vegetables, simmering sauces, and baking bread from scratch. Those days felt like a different version of himself, slower and more deliberate, and he always ended them satisfied in a way that takeout never quite managed.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 블루문 때 한 번 — 블루문은 한 달에 두 번째로 뜨는 보름달.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 일이 매우 드물게 일어남을 강조할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 실제로 한 달에 보름달이 두 번 뜨는 현상(blue moon)이 드물다는 사실에서 유래했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 부정적이지 않고 그냥 드물다는 빈도만 나타내며, 어떤 맥락에서도 사용 가능합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She visits her hometown once in a blue moon.
